# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

- Think through your approach step by step 
We need to take the input string and split it into words. We also need to keep track of the current line length and current word. 
We will iterate over the words, and for each word, we will check if the current line length + word length exceeds the text width. If it does, we add a new line and reset the current line length. Otherwise, we append the word to the current line. We will then assign the result to a variable and add a new line at the end of the string if it does not have one.
